content.question: The derivative of the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="f prime of x equals, 1 minus, 5 times the cosine of, open parenthesis, 3 times x squared, minus 2, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>. For how many values of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the interval <math alttext="0 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math> is the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="y equals f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> at the point <math alttext="with coordinates x comma f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> parallel to the line <math alttext="y equals, 1 plus 4 x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></math> ?

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
